Holidays¶

Class that puts holidays columns in your model object.

city (str)

The city that you want to get the holidays

state (str)

The state that you want to get the holidays

holiday_types (str or list)

Type of holiday

optional

Insert optional holidays such as Teacher’s Day in Brazil

holiday

Insert not optional holidays such as Christmas

special

Insert special days such as Mother’s Day or Black Friday

coverage (str or list)

The coverage of the holiday: ‘national’, ‘state’, ‘municipal’

column_by_type (bool)

If true, for each holiday type will get a column in the datarame, that is, the models will treat them as different variables

eve_column (bool)

If true, an ‘eve_’ + {holiday_type} will be concatenated in the dataframe

days_of_week_to_drop (list)

A list of days of week that you don’t want to consider the holidays in that days.

holidays_to_drop (list)

A list of holidays that you don’t want to consider

{ # on dataprep_config, use the parameters above

    "featurization":{
        "holidays"{
            city :  'rio de janeiro'
            state : 'RJ'
            holiday_types : ['special', 'holiday']
            coverage : ['municipal', 'national']
            column_by_type : true
            eve_column : true
            days_of_week_to_drop : ['monday', 'sunday']
            holidays_to_drop : ['Natal']
        }
    }

}
class vpipe.steps.dataprep.holidays.VHolidays(params=None)[source]¶
create_new_yearly_holiday_df(start, end, day, month, name, holiday_type, state='national', coverage='national', city='national', add_to_class=False)[source]¶

Example function with types documented in the docstring.

PEP 484 type annotations are supported. If attribute, parameter, and return types are annotated according to PEP 484, they do not need to be included in the docstring:

param1int

The first parameter.

param2str

The second parameter.

bool

True if successful, False otherwise.

fit(X)[source]¶

Method that gets all the necessary holidays and prepare the data to be merged in the dataset

Parameters

X (class 'Model Object') – object from class ModelObject

Returns

self

Return type

class Vholidays

get_bool_holiday(start, end, city, state, holiday_types='all', coverage='all', holidays_to_drop=None, days_of_week_to_drop=None, column_by_type=False, eve_column=True)[source]¶

Method that get one or more columns with 0s or 1s about holiday informations

Parameters

  • city (class 'str') – The city that you want to get the holidays

  • state (class 'str') – The city that you want to get the holidays

  • start – The first date of the range in which you want to get the holidays

  • end – The last date of the range in which you want to get the holidays

  • holiday_types (class 'str' or list) – Type of holiday: ‘optional’, ‘special’, ‘holiday’

  • coverage (class 'str' or 'list') – Coverage of holiday: ‘national’, ‘state’, ‘municipal’

  • holidays_to_drop (class list) – A list of holidays that you don’t want to consider

  • days_of_week_to_drop (class list) – A list of days of week that you don’t want to consider the holidays in that days.

  • column_by_type (class eve_column) – If true, for each holiday type will get a column in the datarame, that is, the models will treat them as different variables

  • eve_column – If true, an ‘eve’ + {holiday_type} will be concatenated in the dataframe

Returns

A dataframe with boolean columns

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

get_holidays_by_city(start, end, city, state, holiday_types='all', coverage='all', holidays_to_drop=None, days_of_week_to_drop=None)[source]¶

Method that get the raw table of holidays with this

Parameters

  • city (class 'str') – The city that you want to get the holidays

  • state (class 'str') – The city that you want to get the holidays

  • start – The first date of the range in which you want to get the holidays

  • end – The last date of the range in which you want to get the holidays

  • holiday_types (class 'str' or list) – Type of holiday: ‘optional’, ‘special’, ‘holiday’

  • coverage (class 'str' or 'list') – Coverage of holiday: ‘national’, ‘state’, ‘municipal’

  • holidays_to_drop (class list) – A list of holidays that you don’t want to consider

  • days_of_week_to_drop (class list) – A list of days of week that you don’t want to consider the holidays in that days.

Returns

A dataframe with the holidays, with name, date, coverage and other informations about the holidays

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

Method that insert the holiday data in the Model Object

X Object with the holiday columns
